Bacon’s early work on Grammar and Logic
3. Bacon’s early work on Grammar and Logic

Bacon has a complex notion of grammar. It ranges from the elementary
teaching of Latin through “rational grammar” (linguistics)
to a knowledge of the sacred “Wisdom” languages. It is
also connected with a theory of signs and with the vis
verborum, including the magical power of spoken language. One
notices continuity between Bacon’s early works on grammar and
logic and his later works after 1260 on the theory of signs (De
signis).
